isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - GENERAL INFORMATION - GEAR SET INFORMATION - MARKINGS ON THE DRIVE PINION AND RING GEAR

svcproc.title: GEAR SET INFORMATION - MARKINGS ON THE DRIVE PINION AND RING GEAR

note.para: Before a new gear set is installed in the carrier: ALWAYS CHECK THE GEAR SET FOR CORRECT MARKS TO MAKE SURE THE GEARS ARE A MATCHED SET.

step2.para: Examples of part numbers on gear sets: Ring Gear, 37024K. Drive Pinion, 37024K2.
Location on Drive Pinion: Tip of Pinion Shaft at the Threaded End.
Location on Ring Gear: Front Face or Outer Diameter of Ring Gear.
Example of a Tooth Combination Number: 11-41. The number indicates that the drive pinion has 11 teeth and the ring gear has 41 teeth.
Location on Drive Pinion: Tip of Pinion Shaft at the Threaded End.
Location on Ring Gear: Front Face or Outer Diameter of Ring Gear.

step1.para: Rockwell drive pinions and ring gears are available only in matched sets. The ring gear and the drive pinion in a set have a match number.

step2.para: Example of a Gear Set Match Number: M29.

note.para: A gear set match number has any combination of a letter and a number.

step2.para: Located on the end of the Gear Head of the drive pinion.
Located on the front face or outer diameter of ring gear.

note.para: The pinion cone variation number is not used when checking for a matched gear set. The number is used to adjust the depth of the pinion in the carrier.

step2.para: Examples of Pinion Cone Variation Numbers: PC + 3, PC - 5, + 2, + 1 ( Figure 70).
Located on the end of the gear head of the drive pinion or the outer diameter of the ring gear ( Figure 70).
